reviews.review_msg: Very Engaging lectures, and assignments push you to think critically. He is also a very fair marker and wants students to learn rather than be penalized for minuscule mistakes. One of the best professors at SFU. Assignments can be challenging but he offers alot of options to help students. I would highly recommend, it made me interested in CMPT.

Overall I enjoyed this course and learned a lot about basic programming concepts from Dr. Havens.  The assignments were interesting and challenging.  However this isn't a course you can leave until the last minute and cram for.  If you study diligently and attend classes regularly, it's not too hard to succeed in this course.

He's such a terrible prof. Seriously save your money and time by taking this course with another prof. Assignments are really difficult and his exams are tough. If you plan on taking this course with him you should take a light course load or drop it before it's too late.
People what is wrong with you how come Chris's score is in ones this guy deserves a big ZERO on everything. All i can say is please do yourself a favour dont take his class and i really mean it.

omg...worst prof ever. Like people said, he can't teach, just makes useless powerpoint slides from study guide. I think i would have done way better in this course if taught by another prof ! argh... he just can't teach, no wonder he tells students on the first day of class, that you don't have to come to lecture.

Horrible prof! His lectures are very boring and useless. He does not explain or teach the material. He reads the notes and if u ask questions, he basically repeats the notes. There are 65 enrolled yet 20 show up. You might as well read from the study guide. Put a monkey in front of the class and he could teach the same if not better than Chris.
Honestly dont take tis class with him. i have nothing against him but u honestly wont learn alot

The worst prof ever. He just 'assumes' that every student in his class is an expert in python. He doesn't go over the basics of programming and doesn't hesitate to screw you over with those hard tests, labs, assignments. He just can't teach.
Do yourself a favor and stay away. If they don't offer CMPT 120 in Burnaby with any other professor, it is seriously worth it to take CMPT 120 at SFU Surrey with someone who knows how to teach.

Chris is the worst prof I've ever encountered. He has no knowledge of the material covered in this course. He is very unclear when explaining things. He has no teaching skills whatsoever. He simply makes powerpoint slides from a studyguide that another professor wrote for the same course. He makes no effort to help students who have questions.

The prof doesn't know how to teach, he just assume all other students are expert. this course is just an introductory course to programming, and he never explain through examples, only main theories which we can just read off the textbook... the assignments are extremely hard, tests are so hard too.. avg was very low~ OVERALL WORST PROF I HAVE HAD!
120 with Anne is one of the best CS intros you can get. Watch out for the Mario project at the end, though :)

When I took her class, I was going through difficult personal problems, and she wasn't just understanding, she even gave me a cookie! 🥹 Such a wholesome professor and really cares about students as people, not just academically.

Big time commitment if wanting to do well. Practice exams for participation in lectures. I personally didn't find that the practice exams helped too much with the real exams. 40% final exam. Lectures are recorded. My biggest regret is not going to see her in office hours enough, she is a big help. She does care about your success. Not curved.

Pros: good lectures, records her lectures, friendly and approachable, i love the textbook she uses. Cons: time consuming assignments, not enough time to finish the midterm, takes forever to respond to emails

I took cmpt120 with her and she is a very good teacher and very clear about what she wants. Always read the readings and the questions in them beacause a good part of the exam was from the readings.the assignments werent too hard but grading was not as clear as it should have been.

Although you may see the other reviews, I think that Anne is a great professor.
Pros:
-clear assignment criteria
-cared about her students
-responds to emails
-fair exams
-The course is organized
-marking was pretty fast.

She was okay in the beginning when the concepts were simpler but as we got into harder concepts she went over them very quickly and briefly. Her assignments are okay but take a long time to do and sometimes unrelated to the material. Midterm was impossible to finish in the 45 min as there was 2 coding questions and 11 theory based multiple choice.

For an introduction course, she is THE best teacher if you attend the lectures. If you already know the material you are in for one boring semester, if you're new to python, you're set. She records lectures. Cons: Midterm is just bad. BAD. They are long and contain tricky multiple choice problems. Assignments are sometimes lacking in instructions.
she is kind and funny, i love the textbook she used and her lectures are pretty good too. assignments are quite difficult and the instructions are a bit unclear

She is funny, that's the only redeeming thing about her.  She gives petty, low-key rude responses when you ask a question, she has a "there are such things as dumb questions" kind of attitude.  If you have no experience with code get ready for a C-, she relies on the readings she provides to teach you concepts and will not go over them in class.

As someone with had no prior experience this class was really hard. I did really good on the assignments, ok on the final, but HORRIBLE on the midterm. For the midterm use your time wisely bc many people were unable to finish writing the long codes (worth around 40-50% of exam). People with experience did well, but not a beginner friendly class.

Records lessons which is good but they become boring with time. Goes over harder concepts such as recursion quickly, and spends too much time on easier things. Not a beginner's class but if you have some programming knowledge, it's ok. Sample exams are helpful but be prepared because the final and midterm are worth most of the mark (mine was 70%).

I personally loved this class. The lectures were engaging and all of the material was explained masterfully. Anne is a great prof and I would recommend taking her for anybody. I understand this is one of the easier classes, but I really enjoyed it and think Anne did a wonderful job teaching.

Midterm average was 53. Records lectures so that's nice. Lectures are probably useful for beginners but are mind-numbing if you have any bit of coding knowledge already. Assignments are straightforward but compared to other 120 classes much more tedious. The tests contain trick questions. Avoid if you've never coded before, otherwise it's decent.

I was expecting to get C- but the grade turned out to be ok. The sample codes she provided are usually confusing, although it's nice for her to show us so many examples. Her way of teaching is not so nice for beginners. Make sure to get most of the grades in assignments. And good luck with the exams.
Do not take.

Anne is a kind professor and is very passionate about what she teaches. However, her assignments are extremely time-consuming and are often difficult compared to what she teaches in class. It would be best to spend some time outside of class understanding the concepts and practicing to succeed in the course. Overall, solid prof.

Make sure to pay attention in class and actually make an effort to understand! Do not forget Good Programming Style. The fact that she recorded her lectures was really helped. I appreciated her cheerful and positive attitude! In terms of exam, her multiple choice questions are full of trick questions. I definitely didn't like that much.
I would never take her for another class ever again. She did not help me whatsoever. She will completely ignore your emails if you are trying to ask her for help.

Anne was an alright prof, sometimes her explanations were kinda weird but the content was pretty much an extension of the stuff in the online textbook, and she recorded her lectures, so it wasn't bad. The homework criteria were really clear so that was a nice plus. Still, I don't think she was great per se.

She's an ok prof but I would rather have taken the other CMPT class over hers. As someone new to coding, the class was not easy for me. Her class was 30% assignments, 25% midterm and 45% final, whereas the other class had a more distributed grading system. I liked that she recorded her lectures and her midterm and final sample exams where helpful.

Anne is fine, I'm confused about the low ratings. Assignments are fair, in-fact very easy, and have clear criteria that consist of concepts that do show up on exams; just study her examples and practice basic stuff on your own. Not a fan of the midterm though, too little time for a 20 and 12 mark coding question...
Anyone but her

The content of the course is relatively easy, but Anne's lectures can sometimes drag out. However, Anne is a caring teacher and very helpful when asking a question. Assignments are also very fair and spaced out, giving you plenty of time. Her exams are 50/50: her multiple choice contains some trick questions, but the written parts are very fair.
MID AHH PROFESSOR!!!!!!!!!!!! hella mid fr

As a programmer with programming work experience I took this course for extra credits and the way she puts trick questions in her exams to filter out new computer science students. not a good look. She does not make coding feel welcoming for new students at all. I don't even write reviews but DO NOT take any courses with her.

Puts trick questions on tests. This is especially dumb b/c it's a programming class done and checked without a computer. For example she would put a capital O instead of a 0 to trick us. What's the point? Hard to understand, homework and assignment are unclear. Stay far away.

lectures are useful SOMETIMES when she guides us through writing code step by step , but she doesn't do that often later on in the course. Didn't do any of the required readings but her weekly exercises and assignments are VERY HELPFUL to help you understand python. If you are a cmpt major can't pass 120, change majors, don't blame the prof.

Anne is a nice person but her lectures are all over the place. I've had no previous knowledge in coding and this really hit me like a train. Assignments are extremely time consuming and not worth a whole lot. The lectures are useless. The exams are super hard for an "introduction course". You have to spend a lot of time learning on your own.

She is very knowledgeable but doesn't even know how to explain and the exams are kinda hard. if you are thinking about taking this course with her as an elective and aiming for a A+ let me tell you its really hard not possible for me. She doesn't even explain properly and lectures waste of time since no information is given. Just Relax and Enjoy!

Her lectures are pretty much useless. For an 'introductory' course, the assignments she gives are too advanced. The requirements she sets for each assignment are utterly ridiculous and time-consuming, yet they're hardly worth anything. Exams have lots of trick questions and you only get 45 minutes to do them. Average for the first midterm was 48%.
Worst professor ever.

Anne is very nice and enthusiastic but the way she teaches an introduction computer science course is as if you already have a basic knowledge of the program. No need to attend lectures since the course is basically just readings. Would be better if she broke it down and explained what things meant.
Nice prof but gives 10 minutes for a quiz which would take 15-20 minutes to do. Exams are hard. Study, study, study.

This class was by no means easy. it is meant to be a gpa booster;however, if you take this class with her you will probably regret it too. the average was a C which is the lowest that I have ever heard of in my 4 years at SFU. the messages left on here are misleading of how hard the class actually is. save yourself by choosing another class.

Really good professor. Seems to care about students. Asks for feedback on how to make the course work for students, and tries to implement it. Exams are of average difficulty. The assignments are fun, and often allow for some creativity.
Needs to prepare students for assignments and tests rather than go over the same unclear, bad examples over and over
Easy exam

Great professor that doesn't spoon feed you information, which helps if you have a true interest in programming. Assignments were fair and quite easy if you put in the work, same goes for the exams - sometimes there are even bonus marks available!. She's a kind and bubbly person as well. Very happy to have taken my first CMPT class with her.

Terrible lectures, even worse tests. Very disorganized. Programming projects are very poorly thought out. Asks for good programming style, but has terrible programming habits herself. Likes to ask "trick" questions. Won't post class notes because otherwise no one would attend her lectures. Yes, it's that bad...

she goes at a good pace and explains the concepts very well even though her code it'self isnt well written or structured. Finding your preferred coding structure is your own job. She is the right kind of prof for those who will be experimenting with coding on their own but she will be terrible if you only intend to code for the sake of assignments.

Gives you practically no time for exams and quizzes. Often uses methods in her program that she's never discussed during lecture in quiz questions. Sample programs are littered with syntax errors. Terrible analogies that often confuse me more than clear things up. Whatever you do, find a different prof.

Whatever you do, FIND A DIFFERENT PROF. Spends too much time trying to re-organize papers and talks about simple concepts that barely relate to assignments or exams. Only gives 12 minutes for tests/quizzes and 40 minutes for the midterm. She's really nice and will try to help during office hours, but that's all I can say. I gave up in the end.

Does not know how to teach or make lecture slides. Spends too much time on easy concepts and not enough on the hard ones. Will spend 30mins of a 1hr lecture to do i-clicker and announcements, leaving no time for actual lecturing. And worst of all, literally spent 1hr playing with paper for a lecture. PLAYING WITH DUCKING PAPER!

Worst 'professor' ever. Doesn't explain hard concepts, wastes a bunch of time explaining easy concepts with hand waving, terrible analogies, and a bunch of scribbling.   Assigns an entire assignment and practice problems at lecture 2 days before the midterm.   If you have to take it with Anne, avoid class, read the text, and code.

not sure y everyone hates her. she's really nice and explains very clearly. she knows very well what she's talking about. very helpful if u need help. she set up amazing extra tutorial sections to prepare for final, and those tutorial sections saved my GPA!

Anne took her time to create long review sessions prior to the midterm and final (and was also available during office hours on top of that). Very nice and clearly likes to offer help. Tip: Do the labs and you will do great.

Her lectures are pretty boring and unorganized, so it's easy to blame her teaching for doing poorly in the class. But, a big part of CS is practicing, so DO THE LABS. Anne is a nice lady, she'll help you if you ask. Don't get too discouraged after the midterm, the average for it was 46% but she made the final easier because of it.

As a first year student i though Anne was amazing. Her quizes, tests, assignments were quite tough but her lectures were immaculate. They were precise, clear, and detailed, oh were they extremely detailed! One important thing to NOTE: YOU MUST ATTEND THE LECTURES. If you attended all the lectures this class is an easy A/B. YOU WILL FAIL IF YOU DONT

The dynamic of the class is a bit flawed. She lectures like the class are rookies, but hands out assignments/quizzes that are geared towards semi-experienced programmers. With that being said, if you have any questions I'm sure she would be happy to assist you. She's a kind and helpful person.

The test are hand written when the entire course is online python use. Half the course is teaching you how to write code and the second half is how to find/fix bugs or what has gone wrong in the code. But cannot use any of that knowledge when on a test because, once again, it's hand written. Lectures are very boring!!
projects are hard,even though you get good marks on it,exams,what can i say about it,cheat sheets are useless?and you won't even know why your marks are so low

Know that Anne's notes and powerpoints are too basic to prepare for her assignments and tests. I highly recommend doing all her labs and practicing coding on your own time. The first month or 2 is important because it lays down the groundwork for programming so don't slack off. Textbook, Codecademy  , and online resources are very helpful

Anne Lavergne is a very kind lady who will indeed help you. However, computer science 120 was one of the most difficult classes i've ever taken in my entire life because of her. Her assignments are extremely difficult, her lecture notes are far too simple and vague to use for any of the homeworks, and her midterm is hard. Please avoid this teacher.
Really bad at teaching.. Learnt nothing in her class.... All self study. exams are hard.
Very bad professor. Skims through the hard content. How is this even an "introductory" course?
Avoid at all costs. She focuses on the simple things and makes them confusing, then skims over the difficult stuff. Sparkling mind and unclear
she give tough assignments and quizzers as well as midterm and final youd better choose another professor..........
Assignments and projects are hard. Her lecture slides are unclear and confusing. Most of time you have to self-study and read textbook.
Do not take cmpt120 with this prof. Her notes are not clear, and all over the place.
Excellent professor. Slightly disorganized but makes himself very available in office hours. Crystal clear in lectures, highly recommend him!
I got no programming background whatsoever but I thought he was crystal clear!! and very approachable! Great lecturer and super helpful. Glad I took his class! =]

Excellent lecturer, but a poor professor. He conveys his knowledge well, but possesses poor organizational skills. I would still recommend taking a class with him though as he is very merciful on exams.

This man should not be a teacher. I've learned more from Code Academy than I have from him. The TA's were equally as useless and downright rude. Good luck sending any emails to him or the TAs - you won't hear back in a reasonable timeframe. Avoid at all cost.

took the 120 course. first two labs labeled with 125/126, no course schedule with dates on syllabus, no course website, instructor unresponsive to emails, material and course in general feels disconnected, disorganized, and thrown together.

Very nice prof. The lectures given are pretty clear and helpful.  As an international student, my English is terrible. But he was still very patient listening and explaining to me if u have any problem. So greatful to him.
He is really helpful and a nice prof. Going through all the examples help you succeed.
Great Prof !
He is a very nice guy, very helpful if you go to his office hour. He is willing to give examples and explain to you. Not many assignment but they are time consuming, prepare them as early as you can
very good lectures,but when it comes to assignments,which are somehow much more harder than it was taught during the class,it is not so good anymore. +sometimes late for classes
he is a great prof, so patient and very kind to students
No Comments
Gorgeous prof, lovely lectures, would take again

The assignment grading system is frustratingly opaque. I've followed requirements and gotten same inputs/outputs, yet lost marks without clear feedback. Hard to learn from mistakes when I don't know what they are. A more transparent system would help.
Inconsistent grading criteria. Avoid him since there are many alternative profs available for this course.
His slides are erroneous.

Terrible quizzes. Terrible mistake-riddle slides. 

Won't learn anything in his class.
Great professor, terrible quizzes. If you read the slides and practice outside of your own time, you'll do just fine.

I really enjoyed his CMPT 120 class (it was my first time coding). His slides were easy to understand and follow. He did gave some challenging homework tasks, but the midterm and final exams were fairly easy to score in. I enjoyed this course so much that I decided to change my major!

He's such a kind and caring guy. The lectures weren't very understandable and sometimes legit useless, but the detailed slides make up for it. He's inexperienced with teaching, but I think you should give him a chance, he really tried his absolute best to teach. Assignments/exams were easy & fair (I had some previous programming knowledge though).
All i'm going to say is that he cares more about the class average than actual students learning experiences.

I had prior coding experience and did not need to learn too much new information. However, once I had a question and approached to ask wasn't helpful and it seemed he had limited knowledge especially if you ask out of scope questions. Other students struggled to keep up with the course pace. Generally, I recommend looking for alternative profs.

had zero coding experience and despite this course being an intro level, i really struggled. he ran a very fast paced course with heavy and difficult assignments that a lot of people struggled on BUT hes a super nice guy and really encourages attending office hours or emailing him. he's helpful and really wants everyone to succeed

Poor teaching skills and messy slides. Seemed approachable and organized at the begging of the semester so no one drop the course and afterwards he was kinda rude with monotonic and boring tone and unfair expectations. Just avoid. You learn nothing.

He is one of the nicest instructors I've ever had. He answers questions quickly on Piazza. Many complained about the difficulty of quizzes, but they were definitely doable. They were all online open book too and were only worth 10% of the course. He prepared practice exams for the midterm and final, both similar difficulties to the actual exams.

I'd say with having absolutely no prior coding experience, I found Mohammad to be pretty decent at teaching the subject. However, lectures can be boring, but can't really blame the guy since compsci is boring. He is super nice and caring only thing I would say is that assignments are a bit tricky and gradescope makes the experience even worse.

Coming from someone who's doing well in his class, avoid him (for 120 at least). He is very caring, did try his best, and gave reasonable exams, but his boring and convoluted lectures plus brutal assignments made CMPT 120 extremely painful. If you've never programmed before, good luck, because his expectations are insane for an intro course.

Great professor overall, is really caring towards his students and encourages everyone to succeed. Assignments are pretty tough but he is very helpful if you go to his office hours, and his lectures are also super useful. Final exam was pretty tough but fair, just make sure to keep up with topics and practice often!

Super nice guy and truly cares about his students. Gave multiple extensions on assignments. His exams are fair and the assignments prepare you for the exam. Provides tons of resources and practice questions, and makes an effort to get to know his students.

Prof Tayebi is a really good guy. As a first time coder, assignments were difficult but he was understanding and gave extensions. Exams were easier and are similar to his practise exams. He is really nice, tries to get to know his students, and wants to make sure students learn something and can apply it.

The class was very hard but he was a very caring prof and truly wanted his students to succeed. If you want to do well in this course with him you WILL have to actually put in the time and effort. He was very forgiving and gave extensions. Assignments are made extremely hard implementing everything we learned making the exams easier.

his exams are fair. he provides practice exams that prepare you well enough for the exams. he gave extensions to his assignments, but I feel like he wouldn't need to do that if he made the assignments a little easier. workload can be a lot if you have other classes to prioritize, other than that, he's a pretty good prof.

His assignments and quizzes are really hard, but the midterm and the final were quite fair tbh. He was really responsive and helpful if you asked. There was a free textbook but i feel lectures were better to work from as his slides are informative. Nice guy, gave lots of talks about life.

His assignments are really hard but as long as you put in the work it's possible to get 100 on a majority of them. He truly loves teaching but I think he fails to realize how difficult his assignments especially for people with no coding experience. His midterms are a breeze as long as you understand the fundamentals and review the quizzes

Honestly speaking, he's not as bad as these reviews make him out to be. He's obviously knowledgeable in the topics he's teaching and passionate about his job. He just doesn't know how to relay information well especially to first time coders. His assignments and quizzes are difficult but his exams aren't actually too bad if you studied well.

His philosophies in teaching are respectable but he is not a fitting instructor for CMPT 120. 
Lecture slides contain mistakes, convoluted explanations, unreasonable quizzes, and you're thrown into the fire with homework. If I'm struggling despite having prior coding experience, then I don't know how first-time programmers can survive his course.

His class is not helpful at all. For someone who has no coding experience, this class will make you stress, and it's a waste of time. The assignment is extremely hard than what he teaches in the lecture. You need to learn extra from different website to understand. Overall not worth it for someone who is beginner in coding.

I don't think his teaching style is suitable for lower level classes. His expectations are too high and he does not go over the examples enough for us to comprehend them. Quizzes worded very weirdly at first but it's improved. The assignments seem too complex for it to be intro level but it is possible to get 100 if you work on it enough.

He refuses to give partial marks for anything because "nobody wants half-working code", which is terrible for anybody who has no coding experience, and wants to try it out. Rushes through material, he's gone through about 3/4 of all of the python programming language in a month and a half. Super rude and condescending in his responses to questions.

Assignments are unnecessarily long and tougher than they should be, lectures are dry and not really helpful just read the slides. He was interactive and enthusiastic during the first 2 weeks of class and afterwards he became monotoned and extremely boring causing almost everyone to zone out.

Slides have a lot of mistakes and quizzes are hard. Assignments are tough and even more hard with an autograder. Lectures are confusing and boring. Really frustrating and not beginner friendly like the course says it is

Like the comment below said, the assignment grading system is super frustrating and doesn't let you know where the error is. You could do everything that was asked for in the assignment with identical input/outputs but still get marks deducted.
when people say he has poor english or whatever it's not true. his slides are difficult to follow but it is not due to his language skills

As someone with no coding experience whatsoever, I am struggling in this class as of right now...even though the course description made it sound like it was suitable for me. I do recall the prof saying he was rushing through the basics to give us more time to do other stuff or something like that? And it is NOT working. Take it with someone else.

Lectures are difficult to follow. Professor makes an already difficult topic even worse. His explanations are difficult to understand as he overcomplicates things, and is quite condescending with answers to questions. Goes through the material extremely quickly, and adds unnecessary exploratory topics to the lecture that are not helpful.

Doesn't know how to teach first year courses. He is poorly prepared for lectures, his slides are a mess, the questions/examples are full of errors. He does not teach the material in a clear/approachable way for beginners. The assignment grading system is frustrating and the quizzes are impossible and often include things not covered yet in class.
would't take his class again
irresponsible
Hardest thing I have even done.
Helpful. willing to share and help.

Toby is a great professor. The instructions for the assignments are always explained very clearly and he is genuinely interested in what he is teaching. He provides lots of practice for his midterms and the final. The tests are fair and are a reflection of what is taught in class. I would definitely recommend taking a course with Toby.

He makes learning python for beginners super easy, beginner python is very dry overall but he is a generous marker and cares that you actually pass the class. He also gives a very important outline of what's on the final exam so make sure you do the practice exams. Take it with him!

Attended a couple lectures and couldn't even hear him so I just stopped going. The lectures notes online however are helpful and enough to get by. Just do the weekly quizzes, and then study for midterm and final by doing the samples which are very similar. Did about 1-2 hrs of work a week and still managed to get a decent grade

If you already know Python and basic computing this should be pretty light if not it will definitely take some work. The lectures are a bit dry but the assignments and quiz's are fair and good grade boosts if you don't perform on the exams which aren't super hard anyway.

Toby is a good prof. Lectures are simple and easy to follow, assignments are very helpful, and exams are generally fair. Be careful with those exams though - I underestimated the midterm and completely bombed it. It wasn't difficult by any means, just requires a but of effort.

He was kind of incompetent... He's a CMPT professor but can't set up a microphone. I sat in the 4th row and couldn't hear him at all. I stopped going to the lectures halfway through the semester and just studied and did the work myself.

Pretty mid prof. For context, I already knew python coming into this, the way he teaches python is god awful. He spent way too much time on turtle and txt files instead of more useful things with python like pandas and stats usages. On the final exam, there was a question on something he literally did not cover which definitely f'ed ppl over.

It takes months for him to return marks on quizzes. Each quiz is 10 questions, multiple choice, and online, it should not take months. The midterm was mostly multiple choice and it still took several weeks.

(Fall 2023) 

I think Toby was a pretty decent prof! I *did* go into this class with some existing experience with Python, but I found that his lectures were very straightforward and his personal website with lecture notes was very well organized. He explained things well and emphasized what would be testable. Pretty funny, too!

I genuinely enjoyed toby's class, I am not going to lie we all pretty well initially thought that he wasn't going to be that good but her surprised us all, his lectures were decent but outside of lectures he was incredibly supportive and he provided more than enough materials for all of use to succeed which I genuinely appreciate. GO TOBY :)

Lectures are pretty dry, but technically the teaching style is effective. (Never reads from a slide deck, instead presents a problem related to the topic and solves it in real-time). Occasionally says something funny. Provided resources are really good, (recorded lectures and in-depth notes for each one.) Midterm easier than weekly quizzes.
The assignment is definitely not about what you have learned in class. I have never failed any assignments in any courses but this.

Prof Donaldson was such an amazing prof for 125. His lectures were always really clear and he'd explain concepts from the ground up which is nice because we started learning c. We didn't have any midterms or finals, just a bunch of module quizzes which were pretty easy and the questions were word for word out of the textbook. Overall a great guy!

Great prof, doesn't teach with slides but rather through example-I find this better for programming courses as you can follow along easier. Despite what was previously said, my friends and I found him to be quite funny. Final wasn't too bad, practice the problem sets given!
Odd personality, very intelligent concerning his subject. Tends to have low expectations of students concerning their abilities to provide quality work.

His lectures are ok, they are all online. But he is a little wierd in personality. He makes jokes in class that nobody laughts. I have yet to take his exams but from the looks of the Sample exams they look ok. Point: read the notes online before going to class
Very bad, not clear at all. Does not help with anything, go to another proffs lectures.
Very difficult grader.

Great Professor, probably one of the only professors who asks to write midterm and final code on computer, which is really helpful as you can check your program by running it. Gives partial credit for almost everything, so write something and don't leave any questions.

Nice teacher, but attend pop quiz and weekly HWK. Don't be cheat or copy code from internet or other people, otherwise, it's may lose marks. Easy to pass if you have basic knowledge about programming.
Clear , easy to understand , nice prof, easy assignment and quiz and exam, easy to get high grade
Best prof ever no kidding. He is very helpful, email him if you got any questions.
The lectures are short. The assignments are very hard. The exams are even harder.
Wastes time in lectures. Assignments are nothing like the material covered in lecture. Purpose made the midterm extra hard to drop class average to his standards. NOT RECOMMENDED!

I have been tutoring cmpt120 for 4 years and Steven Pearce is the most ridiculous person I have ever met: his note is formed by some pointless Wikipedia terms and he doesn't even know what he is teaching. His humor is 10 times stronger than his programming skill, so don't expect his help for coding.
too much bs and does not explain wat hes teaching

Teaches a programming course, and starts by telling students that programming is useless and boring.  Only spent 2 weeks teaching programming; rest of the time he just rambled about a variety of unrelated topics.  Final exam had no programming at all; instead was mostly crap about 'theories of webpage design', which was never even in the syllabus.

Very good at clarifying questions. The first half of the course goes by too slowly and the second half is done very quickly so if you have a lot of trouble at the beginning this may not be the course for you.

Prof is helpful during his office hour, really wants you to figure out for yourself how to solve your problem while giving little hints. Lectures are a little boring but informative, bring a coffee to keep awake. Nice professor, will miss him.
He's a good, fair professor. A bit disorganized but lectures are still interesting and he's clearly very knowledgeable in the material.

Very accessible and very generous with his time in office hours. He's well-spoken and also more well-rounded in his knowledge than most cmpt profs. Interesting fellow who made the most of fairly dull material. Doesn't work off slides, takes criticism well--it was his first time teaching the class.  Would definitely take another class with him.

This class is easy as long as you keep you and know what you're doing. His lectures are boring. He gave only 1 assignment before the midterm and 5 assignments due before the final. Unfair marking. Gave 5 questions on the midterm that he DID NOT cover in lectures, then only gave 2.6 more marks. UNFAIR FINAL GRADE! I deserved WAY BETTER.
lecture is ok, but the final grade is really unfair!!! For example, he gives B when you actually can get A. Do not expect a high grade from him.
Inspiring very understanding and easy to follow pace

LOVE him. he is the best prof out thr. no one else can compare, brain, parsa, no one else is better than him. he was my first computer prof. and i think he is the only reason, i was able to continue this degree. I feel like if it was any one else, i would have changed majors. Lowkey sad tho, caz i thought every prof was gonna be like this :(

Professor Vincent was excellent and helpful in and out of class. He would offer extra office hours and help everyone. He also allowed us to have cheat sheets for the final, which no other class had. I would take any class he's teaching.

This is for CMPT 415. He was extremely kind and consistently helpful when you didn't understand things. Very flexible and especially understanding during exam season. Overall, a great professor. If you see this I love you Nick.

Amazing prof - so chill, I'm convinced he meditates before every lecture. Homework and exams? Easier than picking a Netflix show (okay, maybe not that easy, but close). Learned a lot without crying - a rare feat. If I say ‘I approve,' you know it's legit. Take this course with him, or forever regret your life choices. 10/10 would enroll again.

He is amazing! His first test was hard but then he noticed it so made the final easier. We have many coding assignments but are straightforward, and he is always there to help inside and outside of class. He also allowed to have a cheat sheet for the final which is amazing. Honestly do not hesitate to take a class with him.
he is the best prof I've ever had

Dr. Nicholas Vincent is an amazing prof. His lectures are great but not  necessaty and he posts slides and records lectures - although for fall 2024 only audio of lectures was availabile due to technical limitations. Assignment instructions and rubrics are clear and fair, and is very accesibile. Dr. Nicholas Vincent is great and I would take again.

Nick is an amazing professor. He is super caring, he responds very quickly to emails, hes got a good canvas page thats easy to understand and has great office hours. He also give students practice questions that are very helpful for the exams. He is by far the best professor I have had. He is also very smexy.

A great professor for introducing new comers to computer science! Explained at a level where everyone was able to understand and actually incorporated meaningful feedback from previous terms. Assignments and quizzes were well designed to help in learning course content. 

I pray I could have professors like this for higher level courses.

GOATed prof giving amazing lectures and reasonable tests. His email response time was unbelievably fast. He went out of his way to make us a website so we could practice for the final exam. I am so glad I took his class, probably the best, kindest, and most caring CMPT professor at SFU.

Nick is a really really great prof. He is super caring and clearly cares about his students success in the course, he asks for feedback on a lot of the projects and course materials to improve upon for future courses as well. He's also a really good lecturer and Id happily take a course with him as a professor again any time

Boy oh boy where do I even begin. Dr. Nicholas Vincent..honey, my pookie bear. I have loved you ever since I first laid eyes on you. I would do anything for you. I wish it were possible to freeze time so I would never have to leave your side. I would sacrifice my own life it were the only thing that could put a smile on your beautiful face.

Nick has amazing lectures and genuinely wants his students to succeed. He provides so many resources and takes any feedback from students to do well in the course. Super quick email response time as well.

Simply the GOAT prof. Lays everything out for you and describes everything that will be on tests. Responds to emails immediately, and genuinely wants to help you. Provides a variety of resources and tools to help aid your learning.

Nick makes amazing lectures and is so passionate about cs. He is willing to help students in whatever way he can to succeed and provides so many resources and ways to learn and review. highly recommend

Dr Vincent is one of the best profs I've ever had, not to mention he is a HOT HOT HOTTIE. There isn't a single reason I wouldn't recommend this man('s class). Also he has a deep love for memes and AI. He's amazing I wish I could take this class over and over again forever. I love computer science :D
He is a really nice and kind professor

Dr. Vincent was a really good prof. Although he is new, he is pretty well-organized and you can see that he is truly interested in the topic that he teaches. He is very good at answering questions and actually cares about his students. One of the best profs I've had.
Best prof I have taken so far. He even codes with you during class. Very available and helpful office hours. Also pretty clear and concise lectures

I took CMPT 419 Special Topics in AI with Nick in Spring 2024. One of the best profs in CMPT.

He studies and teaches his own research so everything in the class was quite relevant to where computer science is headed. 

You won't learn too much technical work but he connects technical matters with concepts.

Not a hard grader but fair in general.

Took CMPT 419. Easily the best prof in SFU by far. Lectures aren't mandatory but are engaging and interesting. He's extremely passionate about what he teaches and readings are up to date, the oldest being a paper from 2021. He tries to know what students are interested in to include relevant content into the course. Extremely friendly and kind.
The best prof I ever met. He is very open to change teaching style if students ask. The assignments' instructions were clear and easy to follow.

lectures are delivered enthusiastically and in a way that engages the class. all topics are explained intuitively and clearly. all lectures are recorded and easily accessible. assignments and tests contained only material that was taught and there were no surprises. everything was marked fairly generously. amazing prof and course, would recommend
great prof, super helpful and accommodating.

Great proffesor! Prioritized students with frequent office hours and quick email responses as well as offered lots of extra material that was not mandatory but very helpful. He speaks fast but you can always ask him to clarify but other than that lectures were easy to follow and were helpful. Wish I could rate this professor higher he was amazing.

Nick Vincent was a good prof overall. I had zero coding experience and struggled heavily in this course at first. Through hard work, I was able to earn an A-. Exams were fair. Coding assignments can be a bit challenging, final project was a slight test of my patience. Decent experience overall.
Great prof.
i was very scared going into this class but it was actually very manageable. he responds to messages quickly and went above and beyond to provide us with extra resources and help. best prof

Nick is such a caring prof and really does all he can to help students succeed. During his office hours, he was able to help explain why I ran into so many problems or roadblocks during assignments. Lectures are recorded and slides are posted in-advance, so there is no need to rush copying down code. Exams are fair and cheat-sheets are allowed.

He is a very caring person and genuinely wants to see everyone succeed. He had a lot of sympathy since he realized this is a course taken mostly by students in their first semester and contionusly tried to help everyone succeed.
SUPER GREAT PROF! 10/10 would recommend. open to grade appeals and replied very quickly to email. very fair marker and seems like he genuinely wants the best for all his students
best cs prof ever!
He was a nice fellow.

Prof Vincent was a great teacher. As someone who has had no experience in coding i was able to get an A- and understand all the topics. He is very understanding and helpful. The final was a bit tough but overall the material was easy to understand even for a beginner and the class was well paced. I am glad I had him as my prof
Great prof, great communication with students, the course itself is pretty simple but he makes it more convenient for students. Would take him again 100%
By far the best professor I have met this term. I just messed up my final; otherwise, all my grades were good. Getting an A- to A grade in his class is very much possible.
W prof
Great prof. Enjoyed CMPT120 with him this sem. If you already know a bit of coding, this class will be a breeze.

Very caring and always willing to help and answer questions. Friendly and approachable, since it was his first year teaching there were a couple things that were disorganized but VERY open to feedback which was great!
a very sweet teacher who cares for his students. I will say the final was a bit tough but everything else was easy. Glad i got to have him as my prof this semester

everyone ik vibes with prof vincent. he cares a lot about students and if the material is understood and always asks for input on what to improve. he is very considerate and dedicates lots of time to helping out the class and making material easier to understand. i looked forward to lectures as they were always engaging and taught at a good pace.
He was the BEST prof I ever had. the lectures were clear.
Really good CS prof, both for people who haven't and have programmed before. Midterm was easy and final was fair.
my goat
super chill guy and knows his stuff, attend lectures or watch recordings and enjoy the class

The best professor has excellent industry experience unmatched by any other staff.
Unfortunately, he's leaving. I was happy that he was my professor.
BEST PROF
VERY NICE
Interesting prof! better attend lectures tho not necessary. He gives lectures in an interesting way. Homework is straight forward and attending lecture helps. However, marking scheme is unclear.

Attendance recommended, but not mandatory. Doesn't control class very well, too nice to tell everyone to shut up or leave. Assignments were helpful, however the marking scheme is very unclear. Midterm was very fair.
Awesome teacher and really cares about the students. One of the best in the cs department.

You could tell that Hazra knew what she was doing, but she didn't seem too passionate about teaching this course though. When she gave us time to work on a problem, she would often circle around to see if you were working on it which made the class feel like I was in high school. I did learn a lot from this class though.

Hazra's lectures were very interactive as she would always include in-class coding activities. Most of the time her explanations are good, but sometimes very confusing. She often accommodated requests from students for extensions and responded well to feedback.  Quizzes didn't match the material perfectly, but exams were fair.

Hazra is an amazing instructor. Her lectures are understandable and helpful. She is approachable and gives awesome feedback. She encourages everyone to participate in class activities and I personally loved that. I would recommend taking her class!

Hazra is a very sweet professor and puts a lot of time into responding to students questions. I barely scraped by on the exams but that was due to my own poor study habits. Read the class material, practice, ask questions and you will be fine. Hazra is fine for cmpt120 (its an intro programming class it is not that deep). grading is fair.

As a prof she's not the best at explaining things however she does her best to go over it if you ask her questions personally. She quite literally just reads from the slides so you have to make sure you're on top of everything to do well. Going to lectures is important to stay on track or you will suffer

This is a very easy course, but Hazra doesn't meet the standard that SFU should expect of their professors. She seems to put little effort into course structure or creating elegant assignments to reinforce topics. There were even a ton of grading errors. Taking harder courses with her would be awful due to her poor organization and teaching skills.

Took this class with zero background in computer science. I loved it, lectures were clear and easy to understand, and assignments were fairly graded. They were just challenging enough to learn. Questions asked on Piazza or in person were answered clearly and concisely. Would take any class she teaches. I would recommend 10/10.

Was a beginner coder and she explained Python really well, helped me understand programming quite fast. I was irritated about the exam grading scheme where the "predict the output" section was worth 3-4 marks per output, no partial marks, as well as MC changed to be worth 2 pts each. Lost around 15-20% on my second midterm solely on those.

Dr. Imran was an amazing professor for CMPT 120, she was kind and caring towards all students and gave extensions when needed. Midterms were fair and mostly based off assignments, however the final exam was harder and had a heavier emphasis on post midterm 2 material. She really wants all of her students to succeed. Highly Recommend Dr. Imran!
She really tries her best to explain concepts. The only problem is the coding on paper, but she gives even if the code is not 100% correct, and the lectures are a bit boring.

She seems nice, but the way she handles the course seems unfair for students. Passing was determined by a mere pass/fail exam policy despite having several graded assignments. Emphasizes welcoming introductory class despite skimming over content. Difficult assignments with topics not covered before. Also written paper exams for a computer class??

Just awful.
Refuses to use email, so you need to make another third party account, and check that regularly

Lectures are not understandable lots of the time.

She's a nice professor, but very hard to understand and not the best at explaining concepts. The practice problems she gives us for the midterm are way too difficult and involves concepts we never learned. The answer keys are often incorrect as well, which can be misleading for students trying to study.

Even though shes terrible at explaining anything, she refused to record lectures and her thick accent makes it extra challenging for a lot of international students to understand her but she doesnt seem to sympathize.I have no problem with a thick accent but her incredibly poor grammar is also confusing especially for INTRO comp sci. AVOID!

terrible prof. Super unclear, terrible explanations, does not care about student feedback at all. Her lectures are always super vague ppl stopped coming. I was excited to learn comp sci but taking it with her is such a waste of money and time. Be prepared to go to lecture for the absolute worst explanations of basic concepts.
Pooya is a legend at teaching

He is the best prof I've met. He is a very nice and caring prof. He explains concepts well. He won't get pissed of if you ask easy concepts. He is always happy to help you with the course materials. He also uses interesting methods to teach. He brought cups with numbers to teach us the sorting concept. This made me to understand it easier
Lectures don't cover much material, and its very hard to prepare for the midterms and the assignments, as you have no idea what's gonna be on them

Amazing Prof. I'm a student that skips a lot of classes, but I will go to this guy's EVERY class. His notes are 9/10 but his lectures are 10/10 (EVERYTHING is clear after the lecture!). Now onto the bad parts, his labs are extremely LONG, but not difficult, but at the same time FUN. Crazy right? I didn't believe it myself.

One of my favour profs in SFU!!!An awesome, funny guy. Course content is really useful. Just try to do all the labs and pay attention to his notes, you will be find. Have fun with his quiz bonus quesions!!lol~

Discourage students and arrogant. Sometimes goes off topic and end up not finishing the lecture. Can get easy mark with the TA. But do not show your work that is for mark to him he is very pick. If finds he does not find the variable name likable will deduct huge mark.
Awesome Prof!  Colin programs during his lecture, which is terrific. Go to class, do the labs and you will ACE this course. It boosted my GPA :)
The final exam was pass or fail for the whole couse no matter if you did well before. You are expect to work super hard in his class. forget about having fun if you don't already enjoy programming.

Overall, I would say hes a good teacher. He posts lecture notes and goes through them in class and does examples. Lab work relates to his lecture notes, 2 projects, 1 MT, 4 quizzes and 50% final. Material isn't super hard but is workable. I found his class okay enough though I have no prior programing knowledge.

Gives you a penny and expects a million dollars. Course is VERY difficult. Would not recommend to students who are not planning to major in comp sci. This course is a gpa killer. Prof's grading schemes are utterly ridiculous and unfair as well. In hindsight, wouldn't go near this course with a 50 foot stick.

I took CMPT 120 with this prof.(he said he didn't like to call himself as 'prof'). Anyway, his note is very clear and easy to understand, but lab and projects are needed time to finish. midterm and quizzes are getting to difficult and then final exam is extremely hard. Be aware that 1/3 ppl will be fail!
Great prof. If you keep up with the material and and start your assignments early, you will do well. Colin is a very clear, entertaining, and funny lecturer.
I WOULD ADVISE YOU NOT TO TAKE THIS PROF IF YOU ARE TRYING TO BRING YOUR GPA UP BECAUSE HE WILL DEFINETELY CRASH IT.....DONT TAKE HIM

HE IS A VERY INTERESTING GUY AND KNOWS WHAT HE IS TALKING ABOUT ALTHOUGH HE READS THROUGH HIS NOTES. HIS NOTES ARE VERY CLEAR BUT DONT BE DECIEVED .....WHEN THE GUY SAYS HE IS GOING TO FAIL ONE THIRD OF THE CLASS HE WILL FAIL IT. SO I HIGHLY RECOMMEND TAKE ANOTHER PROFF BUT HAVE HIS NOTES. HIS MARKING IS ALLOVER THE PLACE. DONT TAKE THIS PROFF.

Great prof. For me, he really opened wide the world of computing science. Marking was fair and transparent. He encouraged questions and had a genuine interest in promoting understanding of the content. Outside of class, he was always available during his office hours and provided all the tools and explanations necessary to complete any assignment.
I'd reccomend not taking Victor unless you are a masochist.

The content is easy since CMPT120 only covers basic python. Exams were PAINFUL. He puts trick questions that are designed to make you fail. I was getting 100% on assignments but bombed the midterm because he nitpicks at the SMALLEST details to give you the lowest mark. And he taunted us in a public announcement after releasing our marks.

I really enjoyed this class. Victor made it easy to feel welcomed into the learning environment. I wouldnt say its a class for introductory programming however. Starts easy, gets intensive near the end. Be aware of that. They have a rule that if you fail the midterm and final combined, you fail the course. Added stress. Aced all my assignments.

Gives good feedback if you ask for it. Love his drawing sessions before class! He takes students' mental health seriously especially during covid19. Tough grader but has clear grading criteria, also very straightforward. If you got a bad grade, it reflects on your efforts, not his teaching. Would recommend taking courses with him any day!
Good prof, quite relaxed during lectures but needs to cover more advanced programming concepts.
A chill class taught by a chill professor. I would recommend victor any day.

Victors class is so relaxing compared to every other class. Although he some times is slow on getting the harder concepts down during the lecture, hes a must take for any CMPT classes. The midterm was easy, average was really high so I assume the curve will help for that. Assignments are difficult but thats for every section not just his class.

I wouldnt take another class with him. Just to basic and then you are thrown into assignments and midterms on deeper concepts. Class is boring as he takes 15-20 min to start off with some random drawing. It might seem like a chill class, until the midterm or assignments come in. DONT BE FOOLED BY THE FIRST FEW ASSIGNMENTS

Not much practice for a computer class, need more assignments in order to grasp the concepts. Have to do your own readings then go to lecture and listen to Victor speak on the basics of it. Takes to long on introducing the concept and we miss the chance of diving deeper. Not the greatest. I say just wait until its in person as online is harder.
This guy is like the Lebron of teaching computer science. He has a cool McDonalds fit that lets you know the lecture is going to be amazing.

Brian Fraser is hands down one of the most amazing professors at SFU. If you're taking CMPT 120, you're in for a treat. He genuinely cares about his students and makes every lecture engaging, clear, and approachable. His outfits are always amazing, especially the McDonalds fit which is always the best lectures.
Brian Fraser is an amazing professor. Easy and fair midterm + final, great lectures, genuinely interesting to listen to and allows for cheatsheets during exams. Definitely recommend taking him
my first programming prof, didn't realize how spoiled we were

Professor Fraser is an amazing teacher who makes the material engaging. The assignments and exams can be challenging, but he provides plenty of opportunities to boost your grade. For study prep, I found tools like unstuck ai and the free textbook really helpful.
simply the GOAT

You can tell from day one that Brian Fraser really wants to help everyone learn, understand, and master the material. He is excellent at explaining, teaching, and answering questions. The course homepage is super easy to navigate.

society if every instructor put as much effort into their teaching as brian. the course being an introductory course, is not easy. but you have almost endless resources and support. theres office hours everyday on discord and after every class during the week. the midterm was pretty hard compared to sample midterm and assignments but not impossible
he is a great professor, but you need to be extremely familiar with python. Although an intro course , its pretty hard.
Doesn't objectively really get better than this in terms of professors

Lectures are very organized, pauses in between slides to check up on class understanding to slow down or re-explains if needed, doesn't shame you for asking questions, and doesn't tolerate hate speech anywhere. 

GOAT.
Need I say more?
love this guy!!!!
All around amazing teacher. Learned alot from just paying attention during lectures. Projects, assignments, quizzes and exams weren't difficult, but did test your knowledge.

Great professor. Has a clear joy for the subject and for teaching. Records all his lectures. Interesting assignments and generous late policy. Very accessible on Discord and in person. Cares for students and tries to help them succeed.
Super nice and always finds ways to help his students, final was hard but everything else was good
Amazing professor and many opportunities to boost your grade (quizzes, assignments, reflections),  however the final was very hard so make sure you study a lot for it!

He's one of the best professors I've come across, and in the 4 months that I've known him he's become someone I look up to and aspire to be. He cares about his students, really loves teaching and is just a really cheerful person in general. Exams are not easy, but not extremely hard either, you just gotta put in effort and understand concepts.
I love Brian Fraser, only if I could rate him higher :(

Approachable, positive attitude. TA's and prof are accessible outside class on discord if you need help. Lecture recordings online so don't need to come to class (but do anyway because he is a great teacher). Projects every week with up to 4 days late (no late penalty which is flexible). Easy quizzes. midterm is slightly harder. Would recommend.

She's one of the best instructors in the computer science department.
I felt lectures were much more tolerated with her.
Will definitely take every course possible with her

Hearing Angelica lecture is such a pleasure, she clearly has so much passion for her subject and for getting people interested in programming! I would take any class she took, she really prioritizes explaining complex topics in relatable ways we can understand. Come to class because her code-along activities help you really learn and REMEMBER it!

If you have a chance to take a class with Dr. Lim, TAKE IT! CMPT120 is pretty easy in the first place, but that's only because Angelica makes learning so easy and enjoyable. She explains concepts clearly and codes examples in class, and is very approachable for office hours. Assignments and exams were very fair. Overall amazing prof.
Best professor hands down. I would take classes in the future that she teaches just to have her again.

Solid professor. The only thing I would wish for would be video recordings of the lectures as certain topics could use some clarification. 80% of your grade is split between the midterm, final exam and a coding project, so make sure to take those seriously.

Great teacher, lots of Python in class coding so do your reading before lectures. Test heavy, as 60% of your grade came from them but their difficulty is fair. Make sure you start weekly assignments and the final projects EARLY. I would've gotten an A in the course, but I bombed the final project because I procrastinated hard (14/60 lmao).

Dr.Lim is one of the best profs! She is so caring about her students and genuinely wants the best for you to succeed. All her lectures were well explained and she was always open to questions. Go to office hours, even if you have no questions. The course itself is not hard for beginners and the midterms and final were fair. Would recommend 100%

Honestly wonder if a better prof than Dr Lim exists at sfu. So caring and sweet, you'll like the class even if you're not a CS major. Explanations are done well enough that you don't need to read the online textbook but if you choose to, it's in full understandable detail and it's quick to read.

Great prof! She made programming enjoyable and l looked forward to attending each lecture. Her slides and audio recordings are always posted on Canvas, so anyone who misses a class can catch up. Assignments are also super fun!

Angelica Lim is an amazing professor, she is very clear and thorough with her explanations. The issue is the final exams and midterms for this course, which Angelica doesn't create. They're very far off from the class material and mock midterms given before each examination. Have a background in coding for this course, it is not beginner friendly.
Great and energetic prof. Very organized and lectures were easy to follow.

She is a very good professor and made programming very fun. Her lecture materials were very relevant to the weekly coding exercises but she wasn't very helpful when you ask her about content on the midterm since she doesn't make them. CMPT120 is very beginner-friendly but having any prior programming experience in the past will be helpful.

The most interesting elective I've taken but also the hardest (I had no coding experience). An intro class but I found it very hard to grasp the concepts. Assignments were helpful for learning but they also took longer than expected (5-10hrs). Angelica was very helpful and nice but lectures can be confusing at times. Tests were extremely difficult.

Very good prof! Teaches concepts very clearly, tries to make it easy for beginners, and is overall a very caring person. Make sure to read the assigned readings before class, as that helps you understand the lecture's topics better.

Very nice/understanding professor who's always available for help outside of class however her lectures were very different from assignments and midterms/finals. Also, she gave mock exams to prepare us but those did not reflect the difficulty of the actual exams whatsoever. Office hours with the TAs also sucked and were waste of time.

Never taken programming before but made it super manageable for me, used great metaphors, had a great time in all lectures. Would definitely take both class and prof again. Did a great job at accommodating students and answering programming/general questions. Super sweet.

She's really nice and makes an effort to teach at our level. One thing to be wary of are the tests as they don't 100% reflect what she teaches or assignments in terms of how hard they are. Otherwise, pretty solid. Oh and read the readings for sure.

Angelica Lim is an excellent prof no doubt! The class was really fun in terms of assignments but the examinations were extremely difficult. They provided mock exams yet the real exams didn't even reflect 1% of it. I wish they had provided better exams that actually reflected the level of difficulty we were used to and what they prepped us for.

honestly she's a rly nice prof. the class starts off relatively easy (at least for me) but rly gets challenging after the first midterm so make sure u start grinding lol. the TAs for my section were kinda unhelpful tbh but the prof has pretty good office hours and answered all my questions
Really great professor, everything is organized so well especially the readings. Excellent lectures and easy grading for assignments. Tests are pretty hard though. 100% would recommend.

Angelica is a great prof, 120 is a hard class but she made it a lot more easier to understand. Midterm was harder than I thought and nearly nothing similar to the mock she gave to us. Also some of the weekly assignments will took a long time to finish.
really good prof, wants to help her students. her weekly assignments are a bit tough, but not too bad. exams were pretty hard tho

Angelica really pulled through with office hours after each lecture to try and answer everyones questions. She tries to make it as easy as possible to get you to follow along in class, lectures are fun(for what compsci classes can be lol) and her tests are reflective of her assignments. Take her class - best prof in the program.

By far best prof and maybe teacher I've ever had. Super understanding, caring and knowledgeable. Some course work is challenging for new programmers like myself however very doable. As it was online, the course was done through canvas and it was the most organized and nice formatting I have ever seen. Also free textbook recourses so that's a plus.

A caring prof. Materials are conveyed well. Weekly homework 100% sets you up for mid term. I recommend watching the 4 hours Python video on YouTube, which covers over half of the entire CMPT120 course. She is how all profs should be like.

Was hesitant to take this class as I had no coding experience but Angelica is the ideal prof for an intro to coding. Lectures are done at a very manageable pace and you never feel overwhelmed afterwards. Keeping up with weekly practice is absolutely necessary to do well. If you can can do the assignments in a reasonable time, you will get an A
She was my best prof so far I loved the class with her. She also explained really well so if you listen well you don't have to read too much. Take a class with her without any second mind.
No complaints here. She was nice and seemed to use feedback to adjust the course based on how the class doing. Overall, would take a class with her again.

Professor Lim is hands-down one of the best teachers I have had so far in my life. She is caring, adds humor when teaching, goes over examples well, and even shows real-life applications for what we can do with computer science. If you are looking to learn more about computer science or want to get involved with it, look no further than this prof.

A very sweet professor who cares about her students. I had 0 programming background before taking this course and now I know all of the basic fundamentals of coding. Easy class if you pay attention and attend lectures.

Inspirational. Dr. Lim really teaches you in way that is approachable and gives confidence in CS. I didn't have much experience with computers before her class but I learned so much, and enjoyed it so much that I have switched to Data Science major. Grading and work were very fair. If you have the ability to take her class do not hesitate.

Angelica is the best professor I've ever had at SFU. She cared about the course so much and was just an absolute pleasure to be taught by her. The course material is incredibly accessible and engaging. I will drop everything to take another class with Angelica. Do yourself a favour and take any class with Angelica.

Angelica is a sweet prof. You can tell that she is really passionate about computing sciences. I had no prior programming experience, and I definitely found the material challenging at times, but Angelica taught at a fair pace. I recommend reviewing the exam banks as many of the same questions appeared on her exams.

Funny, caring, and kind. A good prof and a great person. She makes classes fun and engaging. You actually feel like you learn alongside her, as she is very humble. Exams can vary in difficulty, but are manageable.

Angelica was the best professor I had in my 3 years of Uni. I only took CMPT because I was interested in the topic, with no previous programming knowledge. Her lectures are clear, her tests tricky but fair and she is very approachable outside of lectures. Highly recommend
She is the nicest prof I 've met. Even if you don't understand any concept, at any point in the semester, she will take her time and go out of her way to explain it to you. Very very sweet. 10/10

The professor is very nice and informative, even though i have no background of coding and never went to the lab to ask for help. I could still learnt alot from Dr Lim, just by attend the lecture(it is extremely helpful). The exams are not too hard, but some of them maybe tricky. However, if you pay enough effort, it will be a gpa booster.

Dr. Angelica is nice and very sweet, though her exams are quite difficult, specifically her coding questions. Although there are only 2 questions, I've heavily been relying on my cheat sheet to SOMEHOW get a code that at least consists of some of the python elements for both midterms. TERRIFIED FOR FINAL BC NO CHEAT SHEET.
Dr. Lim is truly a sweetheart and that is prevalent in her lectures. You can see that she does anything and everything in her power for her students to understand the lecture material.

One of the best professors I have ever taken for a course at SFU. She is very passionate about what she teaches and is also a very kind and inspirational person. If you have a chance to take one of her courses, do it.

CMPT 120 with Diana was awful. The lectures were disorganized and confusing, and she gave little to no real help. Questions were met with vague or dismissive answers. slides are kinda disorganized but you could tell she wanted her students to succeed, rubric was confusing at times and lectures did not accurately cover material that was asked, however, she's pretty chill and gives good feedback/willing to help

Diana is really passionate about the class. She is very caring and very approachable.

10,000% recommend this gem of a professor if you want an intro to CS. She makes overwhelming concepts easy with her calming and kind attitude towards everyone and everything. The way her course is structured also makes u learn very well. She is excellent in Python
She's a great prof for CS beginners. Explain everything well and straight forward. She's also very funny.

Dr. Cukierman is a great professor, she posts the recorded lectures and stays after class to answer questions and really cares about students. The midterm was pretty hard because I ran out of time for the last part, but I would definitely take a class with her again if I could.

Easily one of the most caring and devoted profs I have had! She would literally stay 2 hours after every class just to make sure she could address every student's concern. She is also super entertaining and funny. Take 120 with her if possible!

the course is easy enough but diana doesn't teach at all, you have to read the textbook yourself and google things. one session of introducing the subject and then a heavy assignment. be prepared to do lots of self-reading. but she is fun and makes the course fun and everything.

Diana is AMAZING!! Her lectures are always fun and she makes sure everyone is having a good time learning. Great professor. Wonderful, friendly environment in the lectures. Good vibe overall, very caring for students (reflected in quick responses to questions). loved this class was always the best part of my mornings! great introduction to some simple and some more complicated programming concepts and still a lot of fun if you already know what you're doing what with the variety of homework assignments and final project options. it helped to follow along with all the coding examples in her lectures.
Very enjoyable class and the weekly assignments were easy. The exams were pretty easy too and the prof taught everything well. I would heavily recommend this prof to anyone.
Enthusiastic in lectures, goes over code during class, and assigns reasonable exercises to apply what we learned in class
Great Prof, gave fantastic lectures.

Diana is a great prof and has amazing energy! With that being said, this class is not at all a GPA booster. The people who say this class is easy to have tons of coding experience. This is my first year in computer science and thanks to her excellent teaching of material and availability I was able to really understand the basics of python. She is also incredibly charismatic and the atmosphere of the class makes all aspects of learning programming conducive to learning.

this was the greatest prof and class ive ever had. if I tried a bit harder I would have gotten an A for sure. Study study study.

Very enthusiastic in lectures and she spent tons of time replying to questions on the discussion board, she went above and beyond to help us learn. Diana's a fun prof who seems to genuinely care about her students. She does her best to make the class as fun and engaging as possible, and is very reasonable about marks. Take this class!

We took sorting and recursion at the end, she explained very fast and no HW was given as we had a final project (that was given to us way too late). She's a fantastic prof. Very caring for the students, at the same time makes sure that everything is in order and actually listens to her students. Very enthusiastic and a amazing prof in general. Would RECOMMEND

Prof Cukierman is so kind and caring. Friendly and approachable. Takes feedback from students and applies that feedback to improve her classes, which I think is fantastic. Prof Cukierman is definitely recommended, just be aware that the class gets difficult really quickly; don't slack off just because the first few assignments are easy.

Diana is so sweet and caring. She is however VERY disorganized and you WILL scramble to keep up with her messy slides. Gets off topic all the time. Her European accent is not too thick. She really cares for the students, and time and time again mentions to get good sleep and try to manage stress, and look out for our health. She is very, very enthusiastic. Assignments were easy, the exam questions can be a little confusing though, but fairly easy to study for.

Ok teacher. Her class gets pretty hard towards the end so don't get tricked by the easier assignments at the beginning of the semester. Amazing Prof, approachable, and loves what she does. A great resource, encourages questions, and is always there to help and get the point across. Very fair in grading and assignment distribution and will adjust to make sure that students are learning and willing to try and improve and do their best instead of freaking out over grades. SFU is lucky

Very passionate about the subject! However, found her to be quite disorganized in directions for assignments and explanations during class. I was often confused what was expected of us. BEWARE the final. She's a wonderful prof that makes learning new coding concepts so easy to understand! This was the first coding class I ever took, and I looked forward to the assignments! Diana is a big personality for early in the morning. Super easy class, but she slips a couple surprisingly hard MC questions into exams (expect to lose a mark or two). Diana is the best prof I've had at the 3 universities I've attended. She explains concepts so well ,and keeps the class engaged with iClickers and fun demonstrations. I'd never taken a CS course before 120, and Diana made me passionate about the subject. She's passionate about education, and takes courses to learn new teaching techniques. It shows.

Diana is one of those professors who knows how to teach course content well. She uses good analogies and demos in class to ease understanding. She also gives out a lot of bonus marks which you should capitalize on. Her assignments and exams are not too hard in difficulty, albeit time consuming. I-clickers are also used in class and are worth marks.
Good professor but not the best at getting marks back to you efficiently.

She is amazing! Diana is funny and kind - and explains things in a way that really sticks in your mind. Her examples and demonstrations in class were extremely helpful. She is an awesome professor. She really seems to care that you learn. The course is seriously an easy A if you bother to go to class, listen and follow her instructions on assignments. Great Professor, very enthusistic on the course and very caring as well. Cares about having her students succeed. Would definitely take a course with her again.
Great prof! She is very sweet and caring. Her assignments are a little challenging but that is how you learn. Her lectures are great too!

Diana is one of the sweetest people you will ever meet! She really cares about her students and uses visual demonstrations that really help in understanding the material. She was super caring and always listened to the class. Even when we did bad on the midterm, she was very receptive and helped us improve. Would definitely take a course with her again.
Best prof you could have for this course. Extremely caring, she really wants every student to do well.

I am surprised to see why doesn't have a rating of 4.5+.   She teaches in an excellent manner that really makes you understand how your code works. No question is a stupid question in her class, she welcomes extra inquiries and slowly goes over anything you do not understand. She waits outside the class for some time if you have any quick questions.   Her notes are organized and she posts the annotated notes online after the class (bless her!). Read over the notes before quiz/test and understand all the iClicker questions and the concepts. That's all you need to good on the exam. Don't forget to practice a lot. There are some websites that let you practice your python skills. She lets you use generous amounts of cheat-sheets so do not stress the exams.  Remember Practice is all you need to get A+ in this course.
Lectured well, easy to understand. She is very caring to students, and replied to questions on e-mail and is easily accessible outside of lectures. Would take a class with her again!
Diana is very kind, passionate and caring. She enjoys teaching. Her lectures and labs are useful for the assignments and exams.

I loved her teaching, although it gets a little annoying when she teaches from the ground up and it feels a bit too immature, she explains very well and she is really nice. If you take her courses, be sure to pay lots of attention to her lab exercises and you will do great.

Kind and enthusiastic. It's okay if you don't have coding experience because she makes it accessible for beginners. My TA didn't care what we did in labs - just show up 5 out of 11 times. Great prof

She's the sweetest most approachable lady but her lecture's are scattered and the material is far from clear. The class will be a breeze if you already know python but if not prepare to work.

Diana is a really nice and approachable prof. She really does care about her students and does her best to make everyone pass. Diana was a great professor. Her quizzes and exams are tough, so make sure you are doing the coursework. Her lectures are great because she gives analogies for simplifying some of the rather abstract details of the material. She's a super nice prof! Go to class and do the work and you'll be sailing.
Amazing!

Diana is a lovely person, but an awful teacher. great prof. very kind and helpful! LOVE HER!

Nicest Prof I ever had! She is always talking the most easy knowledge for students, but the project, the exam, and the assignment are really(most) hard that you will do not understand. She can not help you anything. well, she is a super nice prof who really CARES about her students,,the lab exercises are important and relevant to midterms and projects.  the only problem is that people who are good at programming will absolutely do well while those who are not familiar with coding will be suffering for a while,,Overall, the prof is excellent!!
